resources.string: Welcome to the Android Airline application.

This is a read me for the Android Airline project. 
This program was written by Christian Torralba for the Advanced Java course at Portland State University. 
To add a flight, click the "Add a flight" button. 
This will bring you to a page that will prompt you for all the information regarding the flight. 
If the airline specified does not already exist, then one will be created and stored in an XML file, containing all the related flights. 
 
To search for a flight, click the "Search a flight" button. This will then bring you to a page where can input the source and destination of a flight. 
You may also filter flights based on specific airline. 
To view an airline and its flights, click the "Search and Airline" button. This will then prompt you for an airline name. 
If the specified airline exists, then all the flights related to that airline will be displayed. 
You may also leave the airline name text field blank to see all airlines and all flights.
